com.estimote.sdk

Class MacAddress

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.estimote.sdk.MacAddress
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable

    public class MacAddress
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    This class represents MAC address. It is immutable and parcelable.

    • Method Detail

      • fromString

        public static MacAddress fromString(java.lang.String macAddress)
        Creates a new MacAddress object from string.

        Accepted formats are:

        • colon separated - AB:CD:00:12:34:56
        • dash separated - AB-CD-00-12-34-56
        • hexadecimal numbers only - abcd00123456
        • triples with dots - ABCD.0012.3456

        Method is case insensitive.

        Parameters:
        macAddress - String representation of MAC address to be parsed.
        Returns:
        Parsed MacAddress object.

      • fromBytes

        public static MacAddress fromBytes(byte[] address)
        Creates a new MacAddress from array of bytes.
        Parameters:
        address - Bye representation of MAC address.
        Returns:
        MacAddress object.

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes()
        Converts MacAddress to raw array with MAC bytes.
        Returns:
        Raw MAC address bytes.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns human readable representation of MAC address. It is uppercase, colon separated, and inside square brackets. For eg. [AB:CD:00:12:34:56].

        This method should be used for debugging purposes. To obtain formatted MAC address use proper to*String() method.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Human readable MAC-address.

      • toStandardString

        public java.lang.String toStandardString()
        Returns string representation of MAC address - six hexadecimal numbers, uppercase and colon separated. For eg. AB:CD:00:12:34:56
        Returns:
        String representation of MAC address.

      • toHexString

        public java.lang.String toHexString()
        Returns string representation of MAC address - six hexadecimal numbers, lowercase without separators. For eg. abcd00123456
        Returns:
        String representation of MAC address.
